FORM_SECTION.HELP:
Here you can configure SuperProductivity to list uncompleted CalDav todos for a specific project in the task creation panel in the daily planning view. They will be listed as suggestions and will provide a link to the todo as well as more information about it.

In addition you can automatically add and sync all uncompleted todos to your task backlog.

To make it work for nextcloud in the webapp, you might need to whitelist "https://app.super-productivity.com" via the nextcloud app webapppassword.
FORM_SECTION.TITLE: CalDav

HELP_ARR.P1_1: Please provide a login name (can be found on your profile page) and an API token or password if you can't generate one for some reason. Please not that newer versions of Jira sometimes only work with the token.
HELP_ARR.P1_2: You also need to specify a JQL query which is used for the suggestions to add tasks from Jira. If you need help check out this link https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-764478330.html.
HELP_ARR.P1_3: You can also configure, if you want to automatically (e.g. every time you visit the planning view), to import all new issues specified by a custom JQL query.
HELP_ARR.P1_4: Another option is "Check if current ticket is assigned to current user". If enabled and you're starting, a check will be made if you're currently assigned to that ticket on Jira, if not an Dialog appears in which you can chose to assign the ticket to yourself.
HELP_ARR.P2_1: There are several options to determine when and how you want to submit a worklog. Enabling 'Open worklog dialog for adding a worklog to Jira when task is done' opens a dialog to add an worklog every time you mark a Jira Task as done. So keep in mind that worklogs will be added on top of everything tracked so far. So if you mark a task as done for a second time, you might not want to submit the complete worked time for the task again.
HELP_ARR.P2_2: 'Open worklog dialog when sub task is done and not for tasks with sub tasks themselves' opens a worklog dialog every time when you mark a sub task of a Jira issue as done. Because you already track your time via the sub tasks, no dialog is opened once you mark the Jira task itself as done.
HELP_ARR.P2_3: 'Send updates to worklog automatically without dialog' does what it says. Because marking a task as done several times leads to the whole worked time being tracked twice, this is not recommended.
HELP_ARR.P3_1: Here you can reconfigure your default transitions. Jira enables a wide configuration of transitions usually coming into action as different columns on your Jira agile board we can't make assumptions about where and when to transition your tasks and you need to set it manually.

EVAL_FORM.DAILY_STATE_TOOLTIP: Quadrant system based on both scores (‚â•50 is high): Deep Flow (high/high), Overdrive (high/low), Recovery (low/high), Drift (low/low)
EVAL_FORM.IMPACT_OF_WORK: How do you rate the impact of your work today?
EVAL_FORM.PRODUCTIVITY_SCORE_TOOLTIP: 65% Impact (1-4 scale) ‚Ä¢ 30% Focus toward 4h target ‚Ä¢ 5% total work (capped at 10h)
EVAL_FORM.STATE_DEEP_FLOW_HEADLINE: Deep Flow: Excellent focus and sustainable pace.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_DEEP_FLOW_HINT: You‚Äôre in the sweet spot ‚Äî reflect on what made this combination possible.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_DRIFT_HEADLINE: Drift: Low focus and low energy.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_DRIFT_HINT: That‚Äôs okay. Reflect on what distracted you and adjust gently ‚Äî every reset is a chance to learn.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_IMPACT_MISMATCH_HEADLINE: Low Impact: Plenty of focus, little payoff.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_IMPACT_MISMATCH_HINT: You invested solid focus ‚Äî now direct it toward higher-impact work to feel the difference.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_OVERDRIVE_HEADLINE: Overdrive: Productive, but at a cost.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_OVERDRIVE_HINT: You got a lot done ‚Äî now make sure to recharge before burnout sneaks in.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_RECOVERY_HINT: You‚Äôre giving your mind space to recover. Tomorrow you‚Äôll have the energy to dive deeper again.
EVAL_FORM.STATE_STEADY_HINT: Nice balance. You‚Äôre keeping momentum without overextending ‚Äî keep nourishing what makes this pace work.
EVAL_FORM.SUSTAINABILITY_SCORE_TOOLTIP: 45% Energy level ‚Ä¢ 40% Reasonable work hours (0 at 10h) ‚Ä¢ 15% Focus balance (optimal at 4h)

S.SESSION_SKIP: Skip to end of current Pomodoro Session

COMP.INTRO: People with high procrastination levels usually have low self-compassion. So practice it! It improves your feeling of self-worth, fosters positive emotions and can help you overcome procrastination, of course. Try a little exercise:
COMP.L1: Sit down for bit and stretch yourself, if you like, calm down a little bit
COMP.L2: Try to listen to the thoughts and feelings that arise
COMP.L3: Are you responding to yourself in a way that you would respond to a friend?
COMP.L4: If the answer is no, imagine your friend in your situation. What you would say to them? What you would do for them?
COMP.OUTRO: More exercises can be found here or on google.
COMP.TITLE: Self Compassion

CUR.INTRO: Isn't procrastination interesting? It doesn't seem to make any sense to do it, since it is not in your long term interest at all. But still everybody does. It helps a lot explore und gain a better understanding on how it works for you personally! Some basic questions to ask yourself could be:
CUR.L1: What feelings are eliciting your temptation to procrastinate?
CUR.L2: Where do you feel them in your body?
CUR.L3: What do they remind you of?
CUR.L4: What happens to the thought of procrastinating as you observe it? Does it intensify? Dissipate? Cause other emotions to arise?
CUR.L5: How are the sensations in your body shifting as you continue to rest your awareness on them?
CUR.PROCRASTINATION_TRIGGERS_TEXT: Another very effective method is to record, what triggered your urge to procrastinate. For example I personally often have the urge to quickly jump to reddit or my favorite news site whenever my browser window comes into focus. Since I started writing down my triggers in a simple empty text document, I became aware of how ingrained this pattern was and it helped me to experiment with different counter measures.
CUR.TITLE: Curiosity

INTRO.STRESSED: Stressed about not getting things done
INTRO.TITLE: Intro

PROCRASTINATION.P1: First of all: Relax! Everybody does procrastinate once in a while. And if you're not doing what you should, you should at least enjoy it!
PROCRASTINATION.P2: Remember: Procrastination is an emotion regulation problem, not a time management problem. This means beating yourself up is not the solution, it is part of the problem. Let that sink in and then check the other tabs here for some further help.

REFRAME.INTRO: Think about what might be positive about the task despite its flaws.
REFRAME.TITLE: Reframing
REFRAME.TL1: What might be interesting about it?
REFRAME.TL2: What is to gain if you complete it?
REFRAME.TL3: How will you feel about it if you complete it?

SPLIT_UP.INTRO: Split up the task into as many small chunks as you can.
SPLIT_UP.OUTRO: Done? Then think about it. What would be ‚Äì strictly theoretical ‚Äì the first thing you would do if you were to start working on the task? Just think about it...
SPLIT_UP.TITLE: Split it up!

D_INITIAL.TEXT:
The Schedule should provide you with a better picture of how one's planned tasks play out over time. It is automatically generated from your Tasks and requires only time estimates on them to work.

Two things are distinguished: Scheduled Tasks, which are shown at their planned time and Regular Tasks, which should flow around those fixed events.

If you provide a work start and end time (recommended) regular tasks will never show up outside of these boundaries.
D_INITIAL.TITLE: Schedule

S.GOAL_REACHED_1: You reached your goal for today!

A.ARCHIVE_ONLY_UPLOADED: Your data was only partially uploaded. Please try again later! Otherwise you will not be able to sync your data to other devices.
A.POSSIBLE_LEGACY_DATA: Super Productivity has improved syncing by now using two separate files rather than a single one, allowing for much less data transfer. It is recommended to update all instances of Super Productivity and to first sync data from the app instance where the data is newest. If this is the data from your local device then please ignore this warning and just proceed to upload it by confirming the next dialog.
A.REMOTE_MODEL_VERSION_NEWER: The remote model version is newer than the local one. Please update your local app to the newest version!

C.EMPTY_SYNC: You're trying to sync an empty data object. If you are trying to setup syncing from a new app instance, just press OK to load the data from the server. Otherwise, please check your data.
C.FORCE_UPLOAD: Forcing an upload of your data could lead to data loss. Continue?
C.FORCE_UPLOAD_AFTER_ERROR: An Error occurred while uploading your local data. Try to force the update?
C.MIGRATE_LEGACY: Legacy data detected while importing, do you want to try to migrate it?
C.NO_REMOTE_DATA: No remote data found. Upload local to Remote?
C.TRY_LOAD_REMOTE_AGAIN: Try to re-load data from remote once again?
C.UNABLE_TO_LOAD_REMOTE_DATA: Unable to load data from remote. Do you want to try to overwrite the remote data with your local data? All remote data will be lost in the process.

D_AUTH_CODE.FOLLOW_LINK: Please open the following link and copy the auth code provided there into the input field below.
D_AUTH_CODE.TITLE: Login: {{provider}}

D_CONFLICT.OVERWRITE_WARNING: WARNING: The {{targetName}} data contains approximately {{targetChanges}} changes while the {{sourceName}} data only has {{sourceChanges}} changes. Are you sure you want to overwrite the {{targetName}} data with the {{sourceName}} version? This action cannot be undone.
D_CONFLICT.TEXT: Update from remote. Both local and remote data seem to be modified.
D_CONFLICT.TITLE: Sync: Conflicting Data

D_DECRYPT_ERROR.P1: Your remote data is encrypted and decryption failed. Please enter the correct password!
D_DECRYPT_ERROR.P2: Or you can also change your password, which will overwrite all remote data.

D_INCOMPLETE_SYNC.P1: The remote sync data is incoherent!
D_INCOMPLETE_SYNC.P4: 1. Go to your other device and attempt do a complete sync there.
D_INCOMPLETE_SYNC.P5: 2. Overwrite the remote data with your local data. All remote changes will be lost!
D_INCOMPLETE_SYNC.P6: Creating a backup of the data you overwrite is recommended!!!
D_INCOMPLETE_SYNC.T2: Your archive data was not properly uploaded during last sync:
D_INCOMPLETE_SYNC.T4: 1. Go to your other device and complete the sync there.
D_INCOMPLETE_SYNC.T5:
2. Or you can overwrite the remote data with your local one. All remote changes will
    be lost!
D_INCOMPLETE_SYNC.T6: Creating a backup of the data you overwrite is recommended!!!

D_PERMISSION.TEXT: Your file permission for local syncing has been revoked.
D_PERMISSION.TITLE: Sync: Local file permission denied

FORM.L_ENABLE_ENCRYPTION: Enable end-to-end encryption (experimental) ‚Äì Make your data inaccessible for your sync provider
FORM.L_ENCRYPTION_NOTES: IMPORTANT NOTES: You will need to set the same password on your other devices BEFORE the next sync for everything to work. Please select a password that is secure. Please also note that you will NOT be able to access your data, if you forget this password. There is NO recovery possible, since only you have the key. The encryption will probably be good enough to thwart of most attackers, but there is no guarantee.
FORM.TITLE: Sync

WEB_DAV.CORS_INFO: Making it work in the browser: To make this work in the browser you need to whitelist Super Productivity for CORS requests for your webdav server. This can have negative security implications! For nextcloud please refer to this thread for more information. One approach to make this work on mobile is whitelisting "https://app.super-productivity.com" via the nextcloud app webapppassword. Use at your own risk!
WEB_DAV.INFO: WebDAV implementations differ wildly unfortunately. Super Productivity is known to work well with Nextcloud, but it might not work with your provider.

S.ALREADY_IN_SYNC_NO_LOCAL_CHANGES: No local changes ‚Äì Already in sync
S.ERROR_CORS:
WebDAV Sync Error: Network request failed.

This might be a CORS issue. Please ensure:
‚Ä¢ Your WebDAV server allows Cross-Origin requests
‚Ä¢ The server URL is correct and accessible
‚Ä¢ You have a working internet connection
S.ERROR_DATA_IS_CURRENTLY_WRITTEN: Remote Data is currently being written
S.ERROR_FALLBACK_TO_BACKUP: Something went wrong while importing the data. Falling back to local backup.
S.ERROR_NO_REV: No valid rev for remote file
S.ERROR_UNABLE_TO_READ_REMOTE_DATA: Error while syncing. Unable to read remote data. Maybe you enabled encryption and your local password does not match the one used to encrypt the remote data?
S.INCOMPLETE_CFG: Authentication for sync failed. Please check your Config!

SAFETY_BACKUP.DESCRIPTION: Automatic backups are created before downloading data from remote during sync operations. Backups are organized in 4 smart slots: 2 most recent, 1 first from today, and 1 first from a day before today.
SAFETY_BACKUP.NO_BACKUPS: No safety backups available yet. Backups are created automatically before sync operations.
SAFETY_BACKUP.RESTORE_CONFIRM_MSG:
Are you sure you want to restore the backup from {{timestamp}}?

This will COMPLETELY REPLACE all your current data!

Reason: {{reason}}

Click OK to proceed or Cancel to abort.
SAFETY_BACKUP.TITLE: Sync Safety Backups
SAFETY_BACKUP.TOOLTIP_CREATE_MANUAL: Create a manual backup of all your data
SAFETY_BACKUP.TOOLTIP_RESTORE: Restore this backup (will replace all current data)

D_CONFIRM_MOVE_TO_PROJECT.MSG: There are {{tasksNr}} instances created for this repeatable task. Do you want to move all of them to the project "{{projectName}}"?

D_CONFIRM_REMOVE.MSG: Removing the repeat config will convert all previous instances of this task to just regular tasks. Are you sure you want to proceed

D_CONFIRM_UPDATE_INSTANCES.MSG: There are {{tasksNr}} instances created for this repeatable task. Do you want to update all of them with the new defaults or just future tasks?

D_DELETE_INSTANCE.MSG: Remove the repeat task instance on {{date}}? This will prevent the task from being created on this date only.

D_EDIT.HELP1: Repeating tasks are meant for daily chores, e.g.: "Organization", "Daily Meeting", "Code Review", "Checking emails" or similar tasks which are likely to occur again and again.
D_EDIT.HELP2: Once configured a repeating task will be recreated on every day selected below as soon as you open your project and will be automatically marked as completed at the end of the day. They will be handled as different instances. So you can freely add sub tasks etc.
D_EDIT.HELP3: Tasks imported from Jira or Git Issues cannot be repeated.
D_EDIT.HELP4: A note about the order field: Referring to the creation order repeatable tasks. Only in effect for repeatable tasks that are created at the same time. A lower value means a task will be higher up the list, a higher number that it will be further down. A value greater than 0 means items are created at the bottom of normal tasks.

F.DISABLE_AUTO_UPDATE_SUBTASKS_DESCRIPTION: Do not update inherited subtasks automatically when the newest instance changes
F.INHERIT_SUBTASKS_DESCRIPTION: When enabled, subtasks from the most recent task instance will be recreated with the repeating task
F.IS_ADD_TO_BOTTOM: Move task to bottom of list
F.ORDER_DESCRIPTION: Creation order of repeatable tasks. Only affects repeatable tasks created at the same time. A lower value means a task will be created higher up the list, a higher number that it will be further down. A value greater than 0 means items are created at the bottom of normal tasks.
F.REPEAT_FROM_COMPLETION_DATE_DESCRIPTION: The next task is created from your completion date, not from start date. (e.g., 'Every 7 days' = 7 days after completion)
F.SCHEDULE_TYPE_FIXED: Fixed schedule (e.g., every Monday, 1st of month)
F.SCHEDULE_TYPE_FLEXIBLE: After completion (e.g., 7 days after I finish)
F.START_TIME_DESCRIPTION: E.g. 15:00. Leave blank for an all day task
F.TITLE: Title for task

FOCUS_MODE.HELP: Focus Mode opens up a distraction free screen to help you focus on your current task.
FOCUS_MODE.L_ALWAYS_OPEN_FOCUS_MODE: Always open focus mode, when tracking
FOCUS_MODE.TITLE: Focus Mode

IDLE.HELP: When idle time handling is enabled a dialog will open after a specified amount of time to check if and on which task you want to track your time, when you have been idle.
IDLE.IS_ONLY_OPEN_IDLE_WHEN_CURRENT_TASK: Only trigger idle time dialog when a current task is selected
IDLE.TITLE: Idle Handling

IMEX.HELP:
Here you can export all your data as a JSON for backups, but also to use it in a different context (e.g. you might want to export your projects in the browser and import them into the desktop version).

The import expects valid JSON to be copied into the text area. NOTE: Once you hit the import button all your current settings and data will be overwritten!
IMEX.TITLE: Import/Export

KEYBOARD.GLOBAL_TOGGLE_TASK_START: Toggle time tracking for last active task
KEYBOARD.GO_TO_WORK_VIEW: Go to Work View and focus first task
KEYBOARD.HELP:
Here you can configure all keyboard shortcuts.

Click on the text input and enter the desired keyboard combination. Hit enter to save and Escape to abort.

There are three types of shortcuts:

  • Global shortcuts: When the app is running it will trigger the action from every other application.
  • Application level shortcuts: Will trigger from every screen of the application, but not if you're currently editing a text field.
  • Task level shortcuts: They will only trigger if you have selected a task via mouse or keyboard and usually trigger an action specifically related to that one task.

You can press Escape to remove a shortcut.
KEYBOARD.MOVE_TASK_TO_BOTTOM: Move Task to the bottom of the List
KEYBOARD.MOVE_TASK_TO_TOP: Move Task to the top of the List
KEYBOARD.MOVE_TO_REGULARS_TASKS: Move Task to Today"s Task List
KEYBOARD.TASK_MOVE_TO_PROJECT: Open move task to project menu
KEYBOARD.TASK_SHORTCUTS_INFO: The following shortcuts apply for the currently selected task (selected via tab or mouse).
KEYBOARD.TITLE: Keyboard Shortcuts

MISC.IS_TURN_OFF_MARKDOWN: Turn off markdown parsing for task notes
MISC.START_OF_NEXT_DAY: Start time of the next day
MISC.START_OF_NEXT_DAY_HINT: from when (in hour) you want to count the next day has started. default is midnight which is 0.
MISC.TITLE: Misc Settings

POMODORO.CYCLES_BEFORE_LONGER_BREAK: Start longer break after X work sessions
POMODORO.HELP:
The pomodoro timer can be configured via a couple of settings. The duration of every work session, the duration of normal breaks, the number of work sessions to run before a longer break is started and the duration of this longer break.

You can also set if you want to display your distractions during your pomodoro breaks.

Setting "Pause time tracking on pomodoro break" will also track your breaks as work time spent on a task.

Enabling "Pause pomodoro session when no active task" will also pause the pomodoro session, when you pause a task.
POMODORO.IS_DISABLE_AUTO_START_AFTER_BREAK: Disable auto-start of session after break
POMODORO.IS_MANUAL_CONTINUE: Manually confirm starting next pomodoro session
POMODORO.IS_PLAY_SOUND: Play sound when session is done
POMODORO.IS_PLAY_SOUND_AFTER_BREAK: Play sound when break is done
POMODORO.IS_STOP_TRACKING_ON_BREAK: Stop time tracking for task on break
POMODORO.TITLE: Pomodoro Timer (legacy)

REMINDER.COUNTDOWN_DURATION: Show banner X before the actual reminder

REMINDER.IS_COUNTDOWN_BANNER_ENABLED: Show countdown banner before reminders are due
REMINDER.TITLE: Reminders

SCHEDULE.HELP: The schedule feature should provide you with a quick overview over how your planned tasks play out over time. You can find it in the left hand menu under 'Schedule'.
SCHEDULE.L_IS_WORK_START_END_ENABLED: Limit unscheduled task flow to specific work times

TAKE_A_BREAK.FULL_SCREEN_BLOCKER_DURATION: Duration to display the fullscreen window (desktop only)
TAKE_A_BREAK.HELP:
Allows you to configure a reoccurring reminder when you have worked for a specified amount of time without taking a break.

You can modify the message displayed. ${duration} will be replaced with the time spent without a break.
TAKE_A_BREAK.IS_FOCUS_WINDOW: Focus app window when reminder is active (desktop only)
TAKE_A_BREAK.IS_FULL_SCREEN_BLOCKER: Display message in fullscreen window (desktop only)
TAKE_A_BREAK.IS_LOCK_SCREEN: Lock screen when a break is due (desktop only)
TAKE_A_BREAK.MIN_WORKING_TIME: Trigger take a break notification after X working without taking a break
TAKE_A_BREAK.SNOOZE_TIME: Snooze time when prompted to take a break
TAKE_A_BREAK.TITLE: Break Reminder

TIME_TRACKING.HELP: The time tracking reminder is a banner to show up in case you forgot to start time tracking.
TIME_TRACKING.L_DEFAULT_ESTIMATE: Default time estimate for new tasks
TIME_TRACKING.L_DEFAULT_ESTIMATE_SUB_TASKS: Default time estimate for new sub tasks
TIME_TRACKING.L_IS_AUTO_START_NEXT_TASK: Start tracking next task when marking current as done

TIME_TRACKING.L_IS_TRACKING_REMINDER_SHOW_ON_MOBILE: Show tracking reminder on mobile app
TIME_TRACKING.L_TRACKING_REMINDER_MIN_TIME: Time to wait before showing tracking reminder Banner
TIME_TRACKING.TITLE: Time Tracking

APP_FEATURES.HELP: Enable or disable specific app features across the UI.

APP_FEATURES.USER_PROFILES_HINT: Allows you to create and switch between different user profiles, each with separate settings, tasks, and sync configurations. The profile management button will appear in the top-right corner when enabled. Note: Disabling this feature will hide the UI but preserve your profile data (Experimental feature, no guarantees. Make sure to have a backup).
